bibl.title: Reconsidering Some Fiscal Documents from Early Islamic Egypt III.
bibl.note: Continued from: ZPE 150 (2004) pp. 187-193, 2 figg. - 12. B.M. (= 'P. Lond. Copt. I') 1079 = S.B. XXII, 15711. - 13. P. Bal. [P. Bala'izah] 130 App.: entagia produced 'at home'. - 14. P. Lond. V, 1739, (1741,) P. Prag. I, 79, S.P.P. III2, 465: Provenance. - 15. P. Lond. V, 1752: A prompt payment of dapane in wheat. - 16. P. Prag. I, 27: A tax receipt of 741. - 17. P. Princ. II, 92: A hidden deacon and other new readings. - 18. [P. Berol. Inv. 7884 =] S.B. XVIII, 13272: No money, no taxes, but a crux. - 19. [P. Berol. Inv. 7898 =] S.B. XX, 14235: Provenance. - 20. [P. Berol. Inv. 7883 =] S.B. XX, 14236: A curious 'order to pay'. - 21. S.P.P. III2, 474: An amir and his charge. - 22. S.P.P. X, 64B. 4-5. An unrecognized entagion and a pagarch of the Fayum.
bibl.seg: GONIS Nikolaos, Reconsidering Some Fiscal Documents from Early Islamic Egypt III.
